video.title: Spiral Ascension - The Daily Programmer #320
video.description:
Link to the spiral ascension problem: https://www.reddit.com/r/dailyprogrammer/comments/6i60lr/20170619_challenge_320_easy_spiral_ascension/

Follow Cody on Twitter: https://twitter.com/CodyLSeibert

Next problem: https://www.reddit.com/r/dailyprogrammer/comments/6jr76h/20170627_challenge_321_easy_talking_clock/?utm_content=title&utm_medium=hot&utm_source=reddit&utm_name=dailyprogrammer

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.com

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.com

topLevelComment.author: Shubham Rath
topLevelComment.text: What is the interpreter that you are using for js?

topLevelComment.author: Kisan Bhat
topLevelComment.text: Superb. I like the way you explain first and then code. BTW Quokka.js is very useful tool. Thanks

topLevelComment.author: unnzowy
topLevelComment.text: Your videos are really nice. Thank you.

topLevelComment.author: Back Benchers
topLevelComment.text: which IDE or editor you use?

replies.author: Sonia Kurtz
replies.text: Actually it's Visual Studio Code (yes it's free) and Quokka.js

topLevelComment.author: Ian Ross
topLevelComment.text: This is my new favorite series on freeCodeCamp's channel, and I've seen almost everything. Keep up the great work and thanks for making the webcam image smaller so we can see more of the code!

topLevelComment.author: deed
topLevelComment.text: Please record your voice louder in the future. I watch your videos at work on my phone and it's hard to hear you clearly. Otherwise, awesome videos, thank you for taking the time to make these !
